help-file.title: SAY TELL WHISPER ASK
help-file.content:
Syntax: say <text> -or- ' <text> tell <character> <text> whisper <character> <text> ask <character> <text>
In order to communicate with other players, you must begin your sentences with one of the above commands. Use "Say" if you wish everyone in the room to hear you (characters who are asleep are incommunicado, except to gods). The single character ' is a shortcut for "Say" and has precisely the same syntax. "Tell", "Whisper" and "Ask" are used to keep your conversations private and must be accompanied by the name of the player with whom you wish to converse. "Whisper" and "Ask" can only be used if the player you want to converse with is the same room. Whereas, "Tell" is used for global communication. You can "Tell" anyone who is awake and has the tell toggle ON, no matter where they are in the MUD.
Toggling "Tell" will effectively allow you to turn off this line of communication. However, it will not prevent a God from speaking to you.
